divs: Sighting DetailsHello, I saw it too, same city, same object - On July 3rd at around 10:20p.m. I got the urge to put my clothes on and go for a walk around the block. In the last year I have never gone on a walk at night, none the less the day. I just had this sudden urge, and I had to go. I walked around the block and as I came around to my street which is A street Springfield Oregon I noticed towards the North Eastern Sky I noticed a GIANT RED-ISH ORANGE-ISH ORB in the sky, IT WAS PHUCKING HUGE, way too big, I mean, it looked like a small fire in the sky. It was kinda pulsating, and I could tell it wasn't moving because the stars behind it, which dwarfed in comparison referenced the orb as to not moving. What I mean to say is, the orb and the stars were stationary. They weren't moving. But the orb was pulsating, and I began to freak out because I wanted someone to see it too. So I ran back 50 feet to where I saw someone getting groceries out of their trunk but they had already gone inside their apartment. So I ran back to the street and the ORB was still there. A man was getting in his jeep, well he was putting stuff in his jeep, but getting ready to go there was a lady in the driver seat with the engine on. I yelled at him "hey do you see that there, do you see that?!!!" He first said no, and as I pointed towards the sky, towards this HUGE RED-ISH ORANGE-ISH ORB THAT WAS WAYYYYY UP in the sky, but was way to big to be something we could familiarize ourselves with, and that's when he said "Yea...Yea I do see that" I told him "WATCH, IT'S GOING TO DISAPPEAR" and after about fifteen seconds the orb kinda dipped, but it was so far up there, it was a big move, and then it shot into space, I mean, it went out of our atmosphere, it slowly turned into a small dot which was eventually gone into the stars. I looked back at the man and said "see you just saw your first UFO now go study" He didn't say anything back to me.

Summary: Had the urge to go outside, never done that before. Saw the red orb, then it took off into space after a 45 seconds
